skill.name: tdd-pytest
skill.description: Python/pytest TDD specialist for test-driven development workflows. Use when writing tests, auditing test quality, running pytest, or generating test reports. Integrates with uv and pyproject.toml configuration.
skill.summary: Python/pytest TDD specialist for test-driven development workflows. Use when writing tests, auditing...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation in SKILL.md. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external command execution is defined within the skill. The skill provides instructional guidance on TDD methodology and pytest best practices.

content.value_statement: This skill helps developers follow test-driven development practices for Python projects. It guides users through the Red-Green-Refactor cycle, pytest configuration, and test quality auditing.
actual_capabilities: Write pytest tests with fixtures and parametrization
limitations: Does not execute tests directly (AI uses its tool interface)
Does not modify source code automatically
Requires user to have pytest installed

use_cases.title: TDD Workflows
use_cases.description: Follow Red-Green-Refactor cycle when adding new features to Python projects.

use_cases.title: Test Quality Audits
use_cases.description: Review existing test suites for coverage gaps and improve test maintainability.

use_cases.title: CI Integration
use_cases.description: Configure pytest settings and generate test reports for continuous integration pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: New Feature Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write tests for my new function using TDD. I want to follow Red-Green-Refactor. First, show me a failing test.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Run pytest with coverage on my tests directory and show me which lines are not covered.

prompt_templates.title: Fixture Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create pytest fixtures for mocking my database client. I need fixtures for connection, query, and cleanup.

prompt_templates.title: Config Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my pyproject.toml pytest configuration and suggest improvements for better test organization.

output_examples.input: Help me write a failing test for a function that validates email addresses
output: Test checks for @ symbol presence, invalid formats return None
Current test FAILS because function not implemented yet
Next: Implement minimal code to pass this test

best_practices: Write failing tests before implementing code (Red phase)
Keep tests minimal and focused on single behavior
Use descriptive fixture names and scopes
Run tests after each small refactoring change
anti_patterns: Writing tests that pass for wrong reasons (like import errors)
Skipping edge cases and error conditions
Making tests depend on execution order
Hardcoding values instead of using parametrization

faq.question: Does this skill install pytest?
faq.answer: No. The skill assumes pytest is already installed. Use uv run pytest or pip install pytest first.

faq.question: Can this skill run tests in parallel?
faq.answer: The skill guides you on using pytest-xdist for parallel execution. Add -n auto flag to run tests in parallel.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Django tests?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can guide pytest-django setup. Configure DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE in pyproject.toml pytest section.

faq.question: Does this skill access my source code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only provides guidance. Test execution and file access happen through Claude Code tools.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing?
faq.answer: Check pytest output for the failure reason. Common causes: missing imports, wrong assertions, or function not implemented.

faq.question: How is this different from Codex built-in testing?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured TDD guidance, pytest configuration templates, and best practices for test organization.
